author: Hannah Miller
title: Violators of Maryland's coronavirus stay-at-home order face criminal charges, including possible fines and jail time
description: Maryland Gov. Larry Hogan issued a stay-at-home order Monday in response to the coronavirus pandemic and said those who violate it will face criminal charges.
content: Maryland Gov. Larry Hogan issued a stay-at-home order Monday in response to the coronavirus pandemic and said those who violate it will face misdemeanor charges and could face up to a year in prison and a $5,000 fine. The policy is effective Monday at 8:00 pm… [+1787 chars]
